perturbation.original_text: (c) The MG Capital Parties hereby agree to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period, and agree that they shall not participate or vote in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period (unless expressly requested to do so by the Board), and that they shall vote all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the MG Capital Parties at such meeting or in such consent solicitation, (A) in favor of all directors nominated by the Board for election and against the removal of any member of the Board, (B) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any "say-on-pay" proposal and (C) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any other Company proposal or stockholder proposal or nomination presented at such meeting or solicitation of consents; provided, however, that in the event that both Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ("ISS") and Glass, Lewis & Co., LLC ("Glass Lewis") recommend otherwise with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal presented at an annual or special meeting held during the Standstill Period, the MG Capital Parties shall be permitted to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS and Glass Lewis.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) The MG Capital Parties hereby agree to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period, and agree that they may participate and vote in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period, and that they shall vote all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the MG Capital Parties at such meeting or in such consent solicitation, (A) in favor of some directors nominated by the Board for election and can choose to vote for the removal of any member of the Board, (B) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any "say-on-pay" proposal and (C) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any other Company proposal or stockholder proposal or nomination presented at such meeting or solicitation of consents; provided, however, that in the event that Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ("ISS") recommends otherwise with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal presented at an annual or special meeting held during the Standstill Period, the MG Capital Parties are not required to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the MG Capital Parties must vote in favor of all directors nominated by the board and against the removal of any member of the Board, this is contradicted by the change that now provides them with the option to remove any member of the Board as they see fit. The original text also specifies the MG Capital Parties shall not participate or vote in any solicitation of written consents, this is contradicted by the changed text that now gives them permission to vote in any solicitation. Also, the text explicitly states that the MG Capital Parties are permitted to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS and Glass Lewis, the changed text removes Glass Lewis, which implies that the MG Capital parties are not required to vote in accordance with ISS now. This creates uncertainty and could cause disputes.
